Author: mattmaroon
Content:
I think for most people, someone else having their social networking passwords would be mere annoyance, so if any product were at all compelling, they'd have no trouble giving them up. I know that's the case for me. It wouldn't be anywhere close to them getting my email or online banking passwords. The worst they could do is leave obscene comments on my friends' walls.

That said, this product doesn't seem very useful, and I wouldn't expect it to catch on.

Author: wbornor
Title: Scientists and Engineers for America
Content:
Issues of science and technology policy are seldom vigorously debated, and our elected officials are not being held accountable for the actions they take in these areas. As a result, elected officials' positions on science and technology issues do not get the attention and energy from policymakers that they deserve.

SEA has developed a system through which elected officials' positions on these and other important science policy issues can be easily tracked and presented.This is a first of its kind organizing tool that engages citizens in science and technology issues and helps them hold their elected officials accountable.

By bringing these elements together and allowing users to contribute information to the site, SEA will enable the electorate to more fully evaluate their elected representatives, allow individual members to share information on elected officials, and ultimately provide a forum for elected officials to communicate with their constituents on their science policy positions.
